name: mutagenically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is able to cause a permanent change in an organism's genes: mutagenically active To pose a genetic risk to humans, a chemical must be mutagenically active. Viruses, along with certain chemicals, can function mutagenically.
More examplesFewer examplesThe compound is mutagenically active at this dose. The mutagenically inactive compound is still toxic.This process is likely to be mutagenically significant.They have analyzed the mutagenically altered versions of the enzyme.Our work aims to isolate and identify the mutagenically active components in the oil.
